title: Healthy Baked Popcorn Shrimp
summary: Healthy Baked Popcorn Shrimp might be just the American recipe you are searching for. One serving contains 1027 calories, 71g of protein, and 17g of fat. For $5.33 per serving, this recipe covers 46% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. Head to the store and pick up all purpose flour, cornmeal, egg, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the cornmeal you could follow this main course with the Cornmeal Pie as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 8 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. 4 people were glad they tried this recipe. It works well as an expensive main course. With a spoonacular score of 90%, this dish is excellent. Similar recipes include Popcorn-Crusted Popcorn Shrimp, Healthy Peanut Butter Caramel Popcorn, and Kids Can Make: Healthy Taco Popcorn.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.
